intro: Senecio barrelieri, commonly known as the Barrelier's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Senecio barrelieri is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
